lines.text: Dying together's even more personal than living together.

[to the delirious Gus]
There's Rosie! She's waiting for you!
[Willy pushes Gus overboard]
A guy can't help being a German if he's born a German, can he?

[referring to Willie]
Neither can a snake help being a rattlesnake if he's born a rattlesnake! That don't make him a nightingale! Get him out of here!

My name is Schmidt, but I changed it to Smith. That's what I got against these guys more than anything else. They make me ashamed of the name I was born with. I got a lot of relatives in Germany. For all I know this guy may be one of them. I say throw him to the sharks!

[fixing her diamond bracelet]
Looks like bits of ice.
I wish they were.
They're really nothing but a few pieces of carbon crystallized under high pressure at great heat.
Quite so, if you want to be scientific about it.
I'm a great believer in science.
Like tears, for instance. They're nothing but H2O with a trace of sodium chloride.

[seeing a bejewelled Connie in a fur coat as he enters the lifeboat]
Connie! Did you come from the freighter or the Stork Club?

[after the young German sailor pulls a gun]
The baby has a toy!

[On the tattoos on Kovac's chest, especially the heart with the letters B.M]
Her initials are larger than the others. Was she the last or the first? What was her name?

[about Willy]
He's not like us! He's made of iron, we're just flesh and blood! Hungry and thirsty flesh and blood!
[doubles over sobbing in hunger]

[to Ritt]
What do you know about a ship?
Among other things, he just happens to own a shipyard, that's all.
Has he ever been in it?

[Referring to using her bejeweled bracelet as fish bait]
I can reccomend the bait. I know... I bit on it myself.
[first lines]
[indistinct shouting]
Ahoy there!
[climbs into boat]
Lady, you certainly don't look like somebody that's just been shipwrecked.
Man, I certainly feel like it.

[last lines, translating the German soldier's words]
He said "Aren't you going to kill me?"
"Aren't you going to kill me". What are you gonna do with people like that?
I dunno. I was thinking of Mrs Higley and her baby. And Gus.
Well. Maybe *they* can answer that.
Wow!

[speaking of the disaster]
Reminds me of an air raid once that hit me in Chunking.
Reminds me of a slaughterhouse I once worked in in Chicago. Those Nazi buzzards - a tin fish ain't enough. They've got to shell us too!
Well, folks, we're in business again!
As of now I'm skipper, and anybody who don't like it can get out and swim to Bermuda. What about that?
I'll buy it.
Suits me. What about you, Miss?
I'm for it.
Yes, sir!
Well, if the rest agree.
All right, Commissar, what's the course?
